result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Joseph Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF560, 16CF1, 16CF224, 16CF254 and 16CF282:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Alexis McKinley  DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros and John Kucinski  DF:  Kevin Joseph Hicks appeared. Case called at 9:16 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for plea and sentencing hearing. Atty Petros recites agreement. ADA McKinley in agreement. State is in compliance with Victims Rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CF560 and Ct 1 in 16CF1. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Child Abuse in 15CF560 and Ct. 1 Felony Bail Jumping in 16CF1. On motion of the State without objecton, all counts in 16CF224, 16CF254 and 16CF282 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders:

15CF560:

- Impose 100 days jail. 5 day jail credit. Commence jail no later than 9-11-2016 at noon. Bond will remain until reports to jail

- Court costs in the amount of $268.00

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00

16CF1:

- Impose 100 days straight jail. 5 day jail credit. Run concurrent to 15CF560. Commence jail no later than 9-11-2016 at noon. Bond will remain until reports to jail

- Court costs in the amount of $268.00

- DNA Sample. Waive DNA Surcharge

DE to set up a payment plan. Court costs to be suspended for the duration of jail sentence plus an an additional 60 days.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros & DF ATTY John Kucinski & DF ATTY Alex Andrea, DF: Kevin Joseph Hicks appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CF560, 16CF01, 16CF224, 16CF254 & 16CF282.  There is an agreement.  Court sets bond on 16CF282.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing on all files.  Verified the DE's address.  Bonds are continued on all files.  Court adjourned.  lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Benoy    8:54   ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Kevin Joseph Hicks appeared.  Court takes judicial notice of 15CF560.  State calls Deputy James Sander.  S/T James Sander.  ADA McKinley questions witness.  Witness identifies DF.  Atty Kucinski cross.  Redirect.  Argument by Atty Kucinski.  Court finds probable cause and binds the DF over for trial.    Court administratively assigns case to RMW. mab
Preliminary hearing at 01-12-2016 08:30 am

- DE to post$250.00 no later than 01-11-2016 by 5:00pm.  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Lynn Strege.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF:  Kevin Joseph Hicks appeared.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights.
